Tearsheet icons

Tearshees act as a universal companion icon to upcoming Meetups. They contain the date of the event, but should never be relied on as the only conveyance of the event date.

.tearsheet-25, .tearsheet, .tearsheet-80

Oct 25 Oct ## Oct 80 
 <time class="tearsheet-25">
	<span class="month">Oct</span>
	<span class="day">25</span>
</time>

Member Photos

.nametag-photo, .nametag-photo-name

Member photos with nametag gradient

  • Takashi
    Has a square photo
  • Davide
    Has a tall photo
  • Will
    Has a landscape photo 
 <div class="nametag-photo" style="background-image: url(...);">
    <div class="nametag-photo-name">
        <strong>Takashi</strong> <br />
        <small>Has a square photo</small>
    </div>
</div>

Figure set

Figure sets are a common visual pattern on Meetup that consist of a figure (ie. an image) to the left of some descriptive text.

.figureset-right is a variation of .figureset that puts the figure on the right.

This is a title

Food truck vinyl aute irony, umami terry richardson post-ironic ut id stumptown.

This is a title

Cardigan consectetur cillum mollit accusamus letterpress. ...

<div class="figureset">
	<div class="figureset-figure">
		<img src="https://secure.dev.meetup.com/8145363791243687841/img/sassquatch_assets/100.gif" />
	</div>
	<div class="figureset-description">
		<h3>This is a title</h3>
		<p>Food truck vinyl aute irony, umami terry richardson post-ironic ut id stumptown.</p>
	</div>
</div>

<div class="figureset-right">
	<div class="figureset-description">
		<h3>This is a title</h3>
		<p>Cardigan consectetur cillum mollit accusamus letterpress. ...</p>
	</div>
	<div class="figureset-figure">
		<img src="https://secure.dev.meetup.com/8145363791243687841/img/sassquatch_assets/100.gif" />
	</div>
</div>

Basic TouchList

This is an example of the most basic touchlist.

  • Item 1

  • Item 2

  • Item 3

     
<%-- JSP --%>
<div class="doc-box">
    <ul class="touchList">
        <li:item label="Item 1" action="url" />
        <li:item label="Item 2" action="url" />
        <li:item label="Item 3" action="url" />
    </ul>
</div>

<!-- HTML -->
<div class="doc-box">
    <ul class="touchList">
        <li class="touchList-item">
            <a href="url" class="ffbox ffbox--touchList-item">
                <div class="ffbox-flex">
                    <h4 class="touchList-label">Item 1</h4>
                </div>
            </a>
        </li>
        <li class="touchList-item">
            <a href="url" class="ffbox ffbox--touchList-item">
                <div class="ffbox-flex">
                    <h4 class="touchList-label">Item 2</h4>
                </div>
            </a>
        </li>
        <li class="touchList-item">
            <a href="url" class="ffbox ffbox--touchList-item">
                <div class="ffbox-flex">
                    <h4 class="touchList-label">Item 3</h4>
                </div>
            </a>
        </li>
    </ul>
</div>

Segmented Touch List

  • Android Phones
    • Motorola Droid X (2.3)
    • Samsung Galaxy S (4.0)
    • Samsung Galaxy S3 Mini (4.1)
    • Galaxy Nexus 4 (4.3)
  • Windows Phones
    • LG Quantum (7.5)
    • Nokia Lumia 620 (8)
  • iOS Devices
    • iPhone 3G (4.1.3)
    • iPhone 3GS (6.1.3)
    • iPhone 4 (6.1.4)
    • iPhone 4S (6.1.3)
    • iPhone 5 (6.1.4)
    • iPod Touch 5 (7.0)

<li class="touchList-segment">
    <h5 class="touchList-segment-header">
        Android Phones
    </h5>
    <ul class="touchList-segment-content">
